lines.text: There’s… no way this is what happened, is it?
No way what’s what happened?
I mean… why else would Opal hide it with a curtain, though? She had to think it would give the answer away!
Hide what?
Y-yes! Hide what? I- I didn’t hide anything!
The bathtub full of concrete! You covered it with that curtain so we wouldn’t know what was inside!
Th-that’s preposterous. If- if it was involved in some sort of trick, the perpetrator could’ve done it.
Sure, right. The perpetrator, who totally knew the ins and outs of ridiculous police bureaucracy, and would plan around it.
Plan around what? You’re still not explainin’!
Sorry, boss. Let me clue you in:
That statue? Not a statue. But it is the Stop Wizard!
Wha? How’s that?
Easy! That bathtub… he filled it up with quick-dry concrete mix, took a dip, and then climbed out!
He took that pose before it dried, and now…
He’s hiding inside a concrete shell, holding very still, and hoping we don’t call his bluff!
...That’s…
...the craziest in a long line of crazy explanations you’ve cooked up, Seeker.
I should’ve known it was just another joke.
No! I'm serious!
Why else do you think Opal was so opposed to us checking underneath?
It’s a pretty wacky idea, but it’s the only thing that fits the evidence!
...Good lord. You're serious.
And... you’re right. We… have to consider that possibility. Even though… I still want to know <c=#FF00FF>why</c> he’d do that.
Want to crack him open and ask?
Hm...
I bet he’s sweating in there. Worried we’re gonna see through him!
Huh?
Seeker, a word.
Leo brings you in close.
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>If you’re right, the perp might bolt. Let’s wait until we’ve gathered more evidence, first.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>What, you don’t think you can arrest him?</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>It’s a tossup. If he casts that Mass Arrest Momentum thing, he could slip out while we were stuck.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>...So. You want me to take him on, my magic against his?</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Negative.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Awwwww…</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Still. I want you to confirm this. If he’s really in there, he’d need a hole somewhere to breathe through.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Ooh! Good thinking! I’ll take a look.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Hold it. If you find it, don’t tell me. Instead, lie- after you check it out, say that it looks like a normal statue to you.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Should make him think we’ve lost the scent.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>And if it really IS a normal statue?</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Then say the same thing, but turn around and gimme a thumbs down. He won't see it.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Got it.</f>
You look over the statue, searching for a breathing hole.
...Is that…?!
Hmmmmm…
Well, dang.
Dang?
Looks like we were wrong. This is definitely just a normal statue. Nothing weird about it.
...And?
And nothing. That’s all I’ve got to say on the matter.
...Alright, then.
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Keep your voice down from now on. Don't want him overhearin'.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Roger.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Uh- one thing, though- can we just use the normal font size, and the player can pretend we're being quiet?</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Huh? What're you on about?</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>I mean, it'd be annoying to read this tiny font for the rest of the game, right?</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Sure, whatever. I got more important things to worry about.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Containment team, enter the building and stand by to apprehend a magic-user. On my signal.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>And... <c=#FF00FF>Typifacium Gargantuum Non Diegesius!</c></f>
Testing, testing...
Yep, that oughta do the trick.
